course_title: Topics in Spanish Linguistics: History of Spanish Language
class_notes:
(Same as LING 410 1)
Topic: History of the Spanish Language
This course centers around the sociolinguistic development of the Spanish language over the past 800 years. We will examine the fundamental changes in all main branches of Spanish linguistics and the role that language contact (both on the Peninsula and in the Americas), migration, and social status played in the formation of the present-day variation shown in the Spanish-speaking world today. We will also analyze concepts related to language change as they relate to observable phenomena in the history of Spanish.
course_description: Upper-level research seminar on topics of Hispanic linguistics and communication, such as history of the language, bilingualism, or translation. Students may take multiple SPAN 410 courses provided that they focus on different topics.
